Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment: God, after comparing the original film to the sequel based off the trailers, I don't know what to think. Del Toro captured the scale of the Jaegers, you never forget the size of them or that they are machines while still throwing in human like attributes like Crimson Typhoons head shake when it got knocked down. The colors in the original were absolute amazing, the detail work in the CGI is top-notch, the fight scenes are memorable. I feel like in the new one we will lose that feeling of sheer scale, the colors already seem far less vibrant and the Jaegers appear to have lost that mechanical feel.

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment:
I love Pacific Rim... I saw it 8 times in cinema (4 in IMAX) the summer it was released, bought a 3-D flatscreen and bluray player just to buy PR 3-D, Gipsy Danger figures and PR t-shirts, comics, making of books...just love Del Toro's love letter to the Giant Mecha & Monster genres from 60s 70s 80s Japan.

So I think with delToro still producing PR Uprising he must have been okay with how the Next Gen Jaegar's move and feel more atheletic than the Mark III & IV era Jaegars, tech advances for the new Pan Pacific Defense Corp maybe? 

I don't think the Bayformer comparisons are fair based off of a 1st trailer. Bayformer is a tone, an aesthetic of crass taste, humor and shitty designs/action lameness all around...I didn't see that in the Uprising trailer AT ALL...it seemed like the same terse heroic action/adventure about the world coming together to fight a common foe. 

So let's chill in the criticism saying PR Uprising is already shit based off of it's 1st trailer okay peeps?! I'm excited for PR2 big time, screamed out loud when the trailer was shown at my Blade Runner 2049 showing :)

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment:
Why pacific rim 1 will be better than 2 judging solely on the trailers:

-Sence of scale and weight. In 1 you can sence the weight of every punch, every move, every step. You truly feel there is a steel titan walking around carrying the best humanity can offer and it means fking business, same as a kaiju where you can feel the threat of a megamonster, thousand tons of flesh unstoppable and rampant.
Where is any of that in 2? Playdoll mechs wich seem to bemoving as fast as humans, seem smaller (probably are) and so seem the kaijus.
Any combat scenario created under these premuses does not feel like a clash between gargantuans, but more like a clash between a human and bear, with the difference human bear sword type weapons.

-The mechs themselves. In pacific rim 1 you could tell the individuality of the mechs, they had "character" same as their drivers, who can forget the russians? One of my two complains in PR1 was that we didnt get to see much foghting from Russian and Chinese Jaeger, but we still got something and even that little was awesome.
Do you remember any of the jaegers you saw in  PR2 trailer besides the gypsy danger evolution? I dont, while i was fighting with my eyes  in the first trailer to absorb ALL extra detail in the jaegers and kaijus, in the 2nd movie trailer i felt like i didnt care, i can see them clearly and yet the item of focus is their sword not their character.

These reasons alone are 60%-70% of the movie, there are more which i wont wet into atm.

Comment: the movie really is better than the trailer, though that's not really saying much, I personally thought the whole movie was a massive clich√©fest but at the same time I enjoyed it, Kaiju is about the one movie genre Hollywood would have a job to do wrong, all you really need is big monsters destroying big cities and attacking the military and you have a perfect Kaiju movie, though it does also help if the designs are good which I personally felt they were, for me this is very much an eye candy movie; the story can be summed up as "massive aliens attack, yada yada yada >insert Hollywood clich√©s here<¬†humanity makes dem there big ol robots to take out dem there massive aliens" but like I said it's more of an eye candy movie than anything else. Though sound wise I will give credit to the guy who came up with the theme tune for this movie, yeah the theme is simple but at the same time it's hard not to¬†hear it in¬†your head¬†when you see a massive jaegar slowly walking¬†through a city or through the ocean

Comment: hey, just watched the movie and just wanted to give a shout out to say that it was really cool. ¬†I didn't expect the movie to be as cool as it was. ¬†I thought it would just be kinda cool. ¬†and when it first started, i started to feel like it was going to be a bit of a let down because I thought they could have made the robots cooler and could have made the helm in the robots head more high tech; As far as inside the robots head goes they could have made the same exact scenes and set up for that in the early 80's; but never mind that. ¬†the movie was still really cool. ¬†The plot came together so well, u had interdenominational stuff going on, the acting was all really good! ¬†even the aliens were interesting. ¬†and it takes u back to the days when u were a little kid playing rampage against your friends on Nintendo or against the computer at the arcade and smashing up all the buildings in the fight. ¬†The girl had an adorable face too. ¬†When the movie ended I was disappointed because i didn't want it to end. ¬†So yeah, anyone thinking about watching this one, if u haven't already and wonder if u should: I would say u should definitely watch it.

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment:
I'll never know why they picked Rinko for that role, there's like a ton of cuter Japanese girls out there. It's not like there's much acting required. In fact I would have preferred that the character only be able to speak very little English. Firstly it reinforces her close relationship with Pentecost as the only person who can understand her. Secondly it gives the underdog duo of her and Rayleigh not only more hilarious situations but inspiring moments; imagine these two people who can't even understand each other outperforming the other teams who are related by blood. Third, I just have a thing for girls blabbering in a different language or using English like a 3 year old trying to get her point across. She will have very little lines because of her shy nature and only speak in emergency or panic. And there will be no subtitles so we are left trying to guess what she meant through her facial expressions, effectively putting ourselves in Rayleigh's shoes.

In the end Mako just turned out to be a rehash of the Hollywood heroine. She should be extremely shy to give more weight to the importance of her entering a Jaegar; talking to a boy and letting him into her thoughts should be as terrifying as facing a Kaiju.

Comment:
*There is some references to¬†Valvrave the Liberator, where the pilots needs to use their memories as a fuel to keep the robot moving on.*

This movie has nothing to do with Evangelion, Evangelion was a psychological show, the characters, Eva, and their relations were merely psychological theories by Freud, Jung and some philosophers mindsets.

Freud applications:

Asuka/Rei/Shinji as Id/Super-Ego/Ego

Jung applications:
The Evangelions represent the unconscious, LCL represents the Libido, the soul inside EVA-01 represents part of Shinji's anima, the soul inside EVA-02 represents Asuka's anima, Rei is part of Shinji's anima, Eva-00 has no resident soul and AT Field represents barrier between consciousness and unconscious.

If you want to know more, here is a link:
http://wiki.evageeks.org/References_to_Psychology_in_Neon_Genesis_Evangelion

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment:
Dunno what I was expecting, but the trailer made it look like some high-action transformers-like movie.

What it really ended up being was a really cartoonish, comic book-like film with a few minutes of CGI/explosive action, and the rest of it being storytelling (if you can call it that) with mediocre acting.

Maybe that's Guillermo del Toro's style. I dunno. But good god man, if I've ever seen a misleading trailer, it's this. This trailer made it seem like Pacific Rim was a mature themed action movie, not some Godzilla-like cartoon (with a bland plot at that).

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment: I only write reviews when the movie is either very good, very bad, or complex. This movie is very good. The level of detail was Impeccable. The design was ORGASMIC. Even the monsters were beautifully designed. Many of del Toro's favorite trademarks are in this movie: Japanese references, beautifully designed monsters, beautifully designed machines, rich color, fun characters, and self-sacrifice. Every frame of the movie is like a richly detailed painting. It has a simple storyline yet it works, it doesn't need more. The action and fight scenes are Fantastic because they are based on good motives and near flawless special effects. This movie by far surpasses the action and look of Transformers, has the heart of The Iron Giant, and touches upon similar themes as The Matrix (although not as deep). It's an extremely satisfying watch if you're in the mood for a sci-fi action film.

Comment:
I saw multiple references and homages on the film from these Japanese shows:
-Neon Genesis Evangelion (Mako as Rei Ayanami,even her hair had purple streaks; Some Jaegers were designed after the Evas; mind sync to control the robots,etc)
-Daimos (the robots controlled by pilot's body movements)
-Ultraman (fight scenes gigantic Kaiju vs Jaegers fight shot in a city)
-Power Rangers (pilots shout their fight moves lol)

Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed the film. Very entertaining and became one of my favorite films recently. I enjoyed the references too :)

I said it once and I'll say it again and again and again.... Evangelion was not the first Mecha versus Kaiju ever made 1993's Power Rangers, 1984's Voltran, 1981's Beast King: GoLion, 1975's Super Sentai, or 1966's Ultraman all came before it and all lack the over the top and drull teen drama. When I hear that a show or movie is about giant robots fighting giant monsters I want to see giant robots fighting giant monsters not a bunch of two dimentional characters trying to find the meaning to their boring existence through angst and drama. They make dramas for that.

Evangelion: "I can go and fight monsters that are killing or will kill thousands, tens of thousands, or even millions of innocent people because I am the true monster and I'm too busy being angsty to save lives..." That sum up the show?

Just watched watched this movie and though it was pretty good visually I have to say the storyline was beyond terrible. The acting was pretty bad as well especially the asian girl who seemed like she has never acted before.¬†

As the movie was in its final 1/4th I couldn't keep my mouth closed. But it was more due to how bad the writing was especially the ending. Like most of the movie the script was bearable but as the movie progresses it gets more and terrible.¬†

This movie seems to also shout out Deep Blue Sea and Independence day.¬†

Also is it me or did all the monsters look like they came out of world of warcraft with their color schemes and glowing lines.

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment: I FUCKING LOVED PACIFIC RIM!! The action was so damn awesome and kept my eyes glued to my TV screen throughout most of the movie, it's plot isn't complicated or deep, it's just simple and easy to get down with, the acting was quite good, it was a freaking awesome film! A lot of directors seem to forget about the fun of making movies like these, they always seem to go for a deep message and take themselves way too seriously because of it, most of them don't really seem to have fun anymore when it comes to making movies and instead, just do something meaningful and deep, while Pacific Rim reminds us why we love movies in the first place and why we have so much fun watching them, without any deep message or serious dilemma, because it doesn't need any of that and just haves fun with itself while also remaining consistent and even touching. It's clear to me that Del Toro had fun making this movie and knew what the hell he was doing while making this, unlike that shithead, Micheal Bay. There should be more faithfully well done and awesome movies like this, just better imo. ;)

Hey I have an idea! Let's deal with the fact that some people like this movie and some people don't!
Seriously, not everyone's the same, some like movies to have good story and decent acting, some like movies to be more focused on action and special effects.
I personally find this movie good, because it's what was intended to be: a pure action film. Yes, a plot with more twists wouldn't have been bad, but it was still OK. And about acting, the whole film is based on Giant Aliens vs Giant Robots, not Giant Aliens vs People. So yeah, good acting wasn't a must-have for this particular movie.
But that's just my opinion:p

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment: What a lot of the general public doesnt seem to get is that this is more than those generic action movies,a nd certainly more than that micheal bay drek. This is a true tribute to the kaiju genre, and the first great scifi movie that I have seen come out of the big budget works in awile. There IS character development, if you look at the main dude and Mako Mori, this is about getting back on that horse, forgetting the past, and rising up above your problems, like the japanese phrase "GANBARRE" keep on going, without care to whatever you failed at before, rise above it. A great female character that wasn't just there to flaunt her body, and beutiful special effects. To those who say its nothing more than dumb action, thats okay for ypu to think, but dont go thinking you can just debunk all of us who Truely got Del toros vision. Thats the problem with the general public, always taking stuff for face value, i look forward to my fellow kaiju bros and sisters at the new Godzilla next year :)

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment:
From a stand point of a person who has no prior knowledge of Evangelion let me throw my review. Rinko Kikuchi made me hate her character so much that through the entire movie I was hoping Robert Kazinsky would kick her in the face and break her nose. Since this is my first exposure to Rinko I would skip any movie she would make an appearance (Kristen Stewart of Japan). Charlie Hunnam is an ok actor but most of the acting he did not make any sense. Can someone please explain to me why he felt for Rinko's character because I had no sympathy for her or her younger self, all she did through entire movie was cry. Idris Elba Robert Kazinsky and Max Martini were the only ones who delivered in this movie. Graphic work was the best I have seen in a long while. Besides that, the background actors made me lough every time then made appearance; their faces resembled something between "where the fuck am I" and "let me smile the most retarded smile I can master".
P.S
I personally can care less what rotten tomatoes critics, or users rated this movie as. V for Vendetta rated very low and it was one of the best movies I have watched. Grow your own brain and have opinion of your own.

Comment:
yes it's a classic idea...a idea that was originally thought of by the Japanese.

Of course there are some differences between this & Evangelion, but the point is, the concept is still basically the same. Except in Evangelion, the mechas only have 1 pilot each...but have you ever heard of the 1970's anime called 'Magne Robo Gakeen'? In that anime, the mecha also has 2 pilots. 

So the concept of 'Pacific Rim' is like a conbination of Evangelion & Magne Robo Gakeen.

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment: It's a throwback to the old mecha anime and kaiju films of the 60's-80's with characters that, after 30+years, are now archetypical.  They weren't trying for Evangelion, they were creating an entirely new world & ran into the obstacles of making a new IP.  PacRim showed that a live action NGE can be done right, which is promising, but it's subpar box office #s are showing that the general American audience isn't ready yet for anything from the those sub genres.

Just wanted to say that anyone on the fence about seeing this should just see it. The trailers don't do it justice. It's an old school monster movie with mechs mixed in, and Del Toro does the subject matter justice in a way that will make you long to see the whole thing again when you leave the theater.

My only regret is that the movie had to end. I wanted more!

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment: I didn't think there was really much wrong with the story. It's simple, but it works. It doesn't overdo the love story (they never even kiss), and the emotional moments are few but the ones that are there work well. It's a great movie to see in the theater because it's just pure, unadulterated fun. It doesn't try too hard and it delivers on its premise over and over.

Let's start with the fact that Pacific Rim is a homage to series' that came BEFORE Evangelion. Evangelion was really just a deconstruction of the super robot genre as a whole rather than a pinacle of what IS Super Robot Genre. It was not the BEST series of the genre, it was a series that screwed with the ideas and scenarios to make a dark story.
If this WAS an Evangelion knock off then Pentecost would force Mako to pilot a cybernetic clone of one of the Kaijuus who ate her mother.

To all those thinking that a nuclear weapon is the automatic solution, they are wrong in more ways than one.

If there really were such creatures in this film that existed beyond our realm of comprehension, we have nothing that would halt their onslaught.

My two takes...

1.) The "chain sword" weapon was not a part of Jaeger Gipsy Danger's armament until its rebuild. Mako Miro was the engineer in charge of the rebuild and added it in between the five years since Becket was absent from being a pilot.

2.) The "big sword" final weapon is a familiar trope within Giant Mecha and Super Sentai genres. Since del Toro is paying homage to those genres it fits well in how it was executed IMO. Ever watch Voltron? Same thing.

Comment:
Themes from Space Battleship Yamato, Devilman, and MS Gundam, "Monster of the Week" format from tokusatsu/kaiju series, ending and themes from Space Runaway Ideon. Eva 2.0 even had a shot-for-shot homage to an Ultraman film. HIP is a concept developed from that of an old SF novel. 

These are only the ones I know of, there are likely to be more.

The unique aspects of NGE, mecha design and esoteric imagery, seem to be absent from Pacific Rim. The neural connections used are more like G Gundam's.

Comment: I understand where you're coming from.  Since you're a fellow G-fan, I'd recommend giving it a try.  Maybe catch a matinee.  It's not all CGI. This movie is Del Toro's love letter to Ray Harryhausen & Ishiro Honda.

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment: I saw a prescreening to PacRim a few days ago.  It's pretty much a visual effects spectacle.  The 3D rivals Cameron's Avatar.  The story is best described as vanilla with a lot of rainbow sprinkles; simple, but charming.  The action is top notch & plentiful.  It delivers what it advertised & stays true to it's genre.  It's a fun movie if you're still in touch with your inner child.  If you're too "adult" to enjoy childish things then you probably won't miss anything from not watching this.

Comment: In their universe, they didn't set out to design a 2 pilot system, but it ended up being a 2 pilot system as the neural load was too much to for 1 pilot to handle.  Realistically, it's just a plot device to create potential drama between pilots.  Tank crews typically require 4 people, most aircraft have a pilot/co-pilot combo, so there is some precedence for a machine like the Jaegar to require multiple pilots.  Read "Pacific Rim - Tales From Year Zero" for a more detailed explanation.

Comment:
Actually, it is explained. Basically, the Kaiju's blood (you see the parts of them that are glowing blue?) is a deadly poison. The three they mentioned were all killed by conventional firepower, but they bleed a hell of a lot when they die, and hundreds of thousands more perish because of the deadly blood. That's why they built the JEAGERs. Because apparently killing the Kaiju via blunt force causes them to bleed a lot less.

Please do your research before judging something.

U clearly haven't seen the concept book; the kaiju are essentially enormous living, breathing weapon systems that are designed to exterminate carbon-based live forms. Their blood is toxic, so even when they die, they could still contaminate a city and render it inhabitable.  They could also excrete toxic waste; in short, they are terraforming beasts. 

The comic also explains why Jaegars are invented to fight them; conventional weapns are useless and nuclear inflicts heavy collateral damage.

Comment: You must be mad if you think that the big robot (mecha) vs monster concept starts and end with Evangelion. The Japanese Scifi genre is full of examples predating Evangelion as this concept was obviously first used in the Kaiju  60s 70s movies of Godzilla and Toho, as well as numerous other TV series. Evangelion was actually more of an homage to that concept wich had been lost with the advent of the Real Robot Mecha Genre in the 80s, like Gundam and Macross. This is a homage to Kaiju films only.

Having the same genre and plot that Evangelion was deconstructing specifically BECAUSE it was a set part of mecha even by the 90s? As Del Toro makes clear in stuff like the Jaeger featurette, his inspirations go back further - right back to Tetsujin 28, THE first mecha. Robots fighting monstrous abominations is far older than Eva, and even the piloting system is more Gear Fighter Dendoh, than Eva.

Comment:
With a concept of "giant robots fighting giant monsters" levity is ESSENTIAL. Realism is good for dramas, but it's often poisonous to action flicks as you will ALWAYS need to make necessary breaks from reality for the sake of the story/plot and a realistic tone will make those breaks MUCH more glaring.


And as I said before, I hope del Toro makes the fights visible instead of rendering them un-view-able it with shaky cam, dark lighting, and fast edits.

Now copying is a harsh word, bro. While Eva is similar and even inspired by Ideon and Macross, in no way is it copying them. Anno had a certain vision with Eva and is constantly living up to that, just like Tomino and Kawamori did. Even if Rebuild is turning out differently than we anticipated, that's fine because I've enjoyed all the Rebuild films they've released.

We could just give Del Toro a chance and WAIT AND SEE if its really an homage. Here's to hoping he doesn't screw it up.

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]

We're only saying this might be like Eva (not a complete copy) in terms of how they sync their conscience with their mecha...of course the pilots aren't depressed and erratic teenagers or actually being used by their parents/guardians/bizarre Biblical pseudo-alien life forms to complete an ultimate goal. It's just interesting how it resembles both kaiju and tokukatsu shows as well as Evangelion and other mecha franchises. 

What I'm interested in seeing is whether it works or not. :/

Everyone who says this is not like Power Rangers:

"Power Rangers" are an American adaptation of the "Super Sentai" series in Japan, which falls under the media entertainment genre of "Tokusatsu." Giant monster/kaiju movies also fall under "Tokusatsu." So yes, there's a reason why this feels like "Power Rangers" - it comes from the same type of entertainment that the Japanese have created. Don't be so ignorant to say it isn't anything like it.

Read more into "Tokusatsu" to learn more.

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment:
Evangelion did not invent mechs or kaiju, buddy. The first kaiju was introduced in 1954 (Gojira) and the first mech in 1956 (Tetsujin 28-go). And the idea of kaiju fighting mechs have been around for longer than Evangelion as well. Thus, I could say Evangelion is just as big of a rip off as Pacific Rim is, but without all the whiny dialogue and screwball story ideas that are the reason anyone knows of Evangelion in the first place.
Research doesn't take that long, kid. Try it sometime.

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment: The world hasn't been thrown into a dark age or anything. Civilization still goes on, albeit the war with the Kaiju has depleted several countries resources. It's a war of nutrition, humanity can only hold out for so long. In Pacific Rim it's reaching it's breaking point. The Kaiju keep coming, and probably at a much quicker rate than before, so humanity is on it's last leg. If something isn't done humanity will fall. Thus the Apocalypse.

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment:
In his context he means for the definition of 'end of the world.' He is then saying that he is cancelling the end of the world. The words are being used just fine. Apocalypse is actually from the ancient Greek word apocalypsis meaning specifically a disclosure of knowledge; a revelation. In the Revelation of John (ancient Greek Apocalypsis Ioannou), the revelation is victory of good vs evil and the end of present time now commonly used to mean the end of times

tl;dr STFU GTFO

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment: The difference being, Kaiju vs Robot battles don't leave a city blanketed in radioactive fallout after their fight is over. Nukes aren't effective underwater, so you have to wait until the monsters wade into the shallows. By then it's too close to hit them with a nuke with a big enough payload without destroying the city coast. Tactical Nukes were banned by Treaty, so stockpiles consist of Strategic Nukes, aka City Destroyers. Too much boom for monster killing.

Other shows like Kamen Rider and Metal heroes and ultraman are popular toku shows all of which were made into Western shows at some point.

Comment: The difference between a ship and a boat is size. Generally, a boat is a smaller craft than a ship. Ship is the more broad term for any oceangoing craft. A boat is a small vehicle for traveling on water. A boat can have oars, paddles, sails, or a motor to make it move. A ship is a large boat that can travel across deep water, such as a sea or ocean. A ship is built to carry people or goods for a long distance.

Comment: Precisely my point. Conveying all the characters, settings, and scenarios of shows that adequately conveyed them in their original episodic format is almost impossible to do in film feature length, let alone have it pulled off well. That's why there's a cutting room floor, but there are some shows like Avatar that have such a rich and colorful cast and too many episodes that count in the greater picture as a whole that makes such an adaptation impossible. Hollywood really needs to learn this.

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment: Appreciating the two endings and what each ending denotes isn't contradictory. Origin presents a more rational approach to the original (e.g. Gene not wanting to charge in and blow everything up just because he wanted to be a hero, but rather out of revenge for a fallen comrade) and AEC presents EVERYTHING in a far detailed and mature manner, able to detail Tomino's original vision with zero restraints and censors to violent imagery and philosophies. They both FAR exceed the original show, IMO.

Title: Pacific Rim - Official Main Trailer [HD]
Comment:
Yeah it is. It's more of a deconstruction of children's mecha, where kids from around 10-14 are suddenly given robots to fight evil with. Those shows usually never have characters die, since killing of younger kids is a lot rarer, especially since those shows are usually aimed at younger kids. It also deconstructs the whole idea of enemy monsters and how they're always brushed off as just being 'evil' without anybody ever questioning why they are evil.

It's still a deconstruction.
